H0.text: Grasses and trees are organisms that break down dead matter and recycle nutrients back into the ecosystem.

H1.text: Rabbits and deer are organisms that break down dead matter and recycle nutrients back into the ecosystem.

H2.text: Lions and alligators break down dead matter and recycle nutrients back into the ecosystem.

H3.text: Mushrooms and bacteria break down dead matter and recycle nutrients back into the ecosystem.

A4.text: Prime decomposers are bacteria or fungi, though larger scavengers also play an important role in decomposition if the body is accessible to insects, mites and other animals.

A5.text: Animals, such as earthworms, also help decompose the organic materials on and in soil through their activities.
